medical_history.chief_complaint: Painful proptosis in the left eye with episcleral vascular dilation and reduction in bulbar motility.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 month prior to presentation, with slowly progressing pain in the left eye. The patient reported experiencing diplopia in up and right gaze. There was no sign of ocular inflammation in the anterior segment. The left eye motility was reduced in all directions, and visual acuity was 20/60 in the left eye.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a ranger with exposure to tick bites; he reported several tick bites over the last few years, sometimes with erythema migrans.
